requirement: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject.
title: Principles relating to processing of personal data
description: Ensure that personal data is processed lawfully, fairly, and in a transparent manner in relation to individuals.
testing_procedures: Verify that data processing activities are documented and align with the principles of lawfulness, fairness, and transparency.
Review privacy notices to ensure they are clear and accessible.
remediation:
Ensure compliance with data processing principles.
Review and update data processing policies to align with GDPR principles.
Conduct training for staff on lawful, fair, and transparent data processing.

requirement: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: the data subject has given consent, processing is necessary for the performance of a contract, compliance with a legal obligation, protection of vital interests, performance of a task carried out in the public interest, or legitimate interests pursued by the controller.
title: Lawfulness of processing
description: Processing of personal data is only lawful if at least one of the conditions for lawful processing is met.
testing_procedures: Check for documented consent from data subjects where applicable.
Review contracts and legal obligations that justify data processing.
remediation:
Ensure all data processing activities have a lawful basis.
Identify and document the lawful basis for each data processing activity.
Implement mechanisms to obtain and record consent where required.

requirement: The data subject's consent must be a freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes by which he or she, by a statement or by a clear affirmative action, signifies agreement to the processing of personal data relating to him or her.
title: Conditions for consent
description: Ensure that consent is freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous.
testing_procedures: Review consent forms and processes to ensure they meet GDPR requirements.
Verify that consent can be withdrawn easily by data subjects.
remediation:
Ensure consent mechanisms comply with GDPR.
Update consent forms to ensure clarity and specificity.
Implement systems to manage and track consent status.

requirement: Article 41 requires the monitoring of approved codes of conduct to ensure compliance with GDPR.
title: Monitoring of approved codes of conduct
description: Ensure that approved codes of conduct are monitored effectively.
testing_procedures: Verify the existence of a monitoring mechanism for approved codes of conduct.
Check records of monitoring activities and outcomes.
remediation:
Implement a monitoring mechanism for approved codes of conduct.
Establish a monitoring framework.
Assign responsibilities for monitoring.
Conduct regular reviews and audits.

requirement: Article 42 encourages the establishment of certification mechanisms to demonstrate compliance with GDPR.
title: Certification
description: Facilitate the establishment of data protection certification mechanisms.
testing_procedures: Check for compliance with certification standards.
remediation:
Develop and implement certification mechanisms.
Identify relevant certification standards.
Implement processes to meet certification requirements.
Undergo certification audits.
